bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to G. Glenwood Clark, March 20, 1952

div1.p: Hench promises to review Reed's letters to see whether he ever mentioned Susie, an Apache household servant. He will send a copy of Clark's letter to Reed's family, who may remember her.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to G. Glenwood Clark, March 20, 1952
div1.opener:
March 20, 1952
Mr. G. Glenwood Clark
110 North Boundary Street
Williamsburg, Virginia
My dear Mr. Clark:
div1.p:
On my return from Cuba I unfortunately got the flu and have gotten way
behind in my correspondence.

I have your letter of January 2 inquiring of an Apache girl by the name
of Susie whom you say became a household servant for Walter Reed. I do
not remember reading anything about her in Walter Reed's letters to his
wife or family. I shall try to review these letters at my earliest con-
venience. At the moment I am working hard trying to finish two papers
which I am to give shortly and it may be a little while before I can
look this up.

Meanwhile I shall send a copy of your letter to General Walter L. Reed,
and to Mrs. Blossom Reed, Walter Reed's son and daughter. Perhaps they
will remember from their personal knowledge about this girl.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. P SH:alc
